amendatorysection.para: (1) For purposes of eligibility for or entitlement to any educational service or program, any student residing in an affiliated Class I district who is enrolled in the high school program of an affiliated school system shall be considered to be a resident of the Class II, III, IV, or V district which is part of such affiliated school system. Such student shall be treated for purposes of any educational service, including special education services, extracurricular programs, and other school-sponsored activities, as if he or she were a resident student of the high school district.

(2) All children residing in a Class I district or portion thereof which is affiliated who are fourteen through eighteen years of age shall be counted on the school census of the affiliated high school district pursuant to section 79-528.

annotation.para: The phrase "educational service or program" in subsection (1) of this section does not include transportation. State ex rel. Fick v. Miller, 255 Neb. 387, 584 N.W.2d 809 (1998).
